newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Shell Philippine unit cuts LPG price.
newsitem.headline: Shell Philippine unit cuts LPG price.

text.p: Pilipinas Shell Petroleum Corp said on Friday it is reducing the price of its liquefied petroleum gasoline (lpg) by five pesos per 11-kilogram cyclinder effective March 15.
In a statement, Shell said the price of LPG per cylinder will drop from 177 pesos to 172 pesos.
Ed Mapa, corporate affairs manager, told Reuters the cut translates to 25 centavos per litre.
Pilipinas Shell, a member of the Royal Dutch/Shell group, said that the reduction was meant to maintain the company's competitiveness in the local market.

On March 10, Pilipinas Shell along with two other local refiners Petron Corp and Caltex Philippines Inc reduced the price of all petroleum products by an average of 30 centavos per litre, except for LPG.
Shell is the first of the three refiners to cut the price of LPG used for cooking by most housholds in the Philippines.
